intro: Pouzolzia tsaratananensis, commonly known as the Madagascar pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
